alert.note: Alert for Lake (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 11:52AM CST until March 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO WEDNESDAY, MARCH 09... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River Above Tiptonville. * WHEN...From late tonight to Wednesday, March 09. * IMPACTS...At 39.0 feet, In Tennessee, water begins to go over Tiptonville Ferry Road, Barr Road, and the farm land east of the Tiptonville Ferry Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 36.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will begin rising this afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 38.0 feet Friday evening and remain at or above flood stage through early next week. It will fall below flood stage Wednesday, March 09. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
